verses.text_plain: There was a man in the land of Uz, whose name was Job; and that man was perfect and upright, and one that feared God, and eschewed evil.
verses.verse_html: 1There was a man in the land of Uz, whose name was Job; and that man was perfect and upright, and one that feared God, and eschewed evil.

verses.text_plain: And there were born unto him seven sons and three daughters.
verses.verse_html: 2And there were born unto him seven sons and three daughters.

verses.text_plain: His substance also was seven thousand sheep, and three thousand camels, and five hundred yoke of oxen, and five hundred she asses, and a very great household; so that this man was the greatest of all the men of the east.
verses.verse_html:
3His substance also was seven thousand sheep, and three thousand camels, and five hundred yoke of oxen, and five hundred she asses, and a very great household; so that this man was the greatest of all the men of the east. ▼
▼ substance: or, cattle
 , ▼
▼ household: or, husbandry
 , ▼
▼ men: Heb. sons

verses.text_plain: And his sons went and feasted in their houses, every one his day; and sent and called for their three sisters to eat and to drink with them.
verses.verse_html: 4And his sons went and feasted in their houses, every one his day; and sent and called for their three sisters to eat and to drink with them.

verses.text_plain: And it was so, when the days of their feasting were gone about, that Job sent and sanctified them, and rose up early in the morning, and offered burnt offerings according to the number of them all: for Job said, It may be that my sons have sinned, and cursed God in their hearts. Thus did Job continually.
verses.verse_html:
5And it was so, when the days of their feasting were gone about, that Job sent and sanctified them, and rose up early in the morning, and offered burnt offerings according to the number of them all: for Job said, It may be that my sons have sinned, and cursed God in their hearts. Thus did Job continually. ▼
▼ continually: Heb. all the days

tokens.text: And it was so, when the days

footnotes.body_html: ▼ continually: Heb. all the days

verses.text_plain: Now there was a day when the sons of God came to present themselves before the Lord, and Satan came also among them.
verses.verse_html:
6Now there was a day when the sons of God came to present themselves before the Lord, and Satan came also among them. ▼
▼ Satan: Heb. the adversary
 , ▼
▼ among: Heb. in the midst of

footnotes.body_html: ▼ Satan: Heb. the adversary

footnotes.body_text: ▼ among: Heb. in the midst of
footnotes.body_html: ▼ among: Heb. in the midst of

verses.text_plain: And the Lord said unto Satan, Whence comest thou? Then Satan answered the Lord, and said, From going to and fro in the earth, and from walking up and down in it.
verses.verse_html: 7And the Lord said unto Satan, Whence comest thou? Then Satan answered the Lord, and said, From going to and fro in the earth, and from walking up and down in it.

tokens.text: and from walking up and down

verses.text_plain: And the Lord said unto Satan, Hast thou considered my servant Job, that there is none like him in the earth, a perfect and an upright man, one that feareth God, and escheweth evil?
verses.verse_html:
8And the Lord said unto Satan, Hast thou considered my servant Job, that there is none like him in the earth, a perfect and an upright man, one that feareth God, and escheweth evil? ▼
▼ considered: Heb. set thy heart on

tokens.text: none like him in the earth

footnotes.body_text: ▼ considered: Heb. set thy heart on
footnotes.body_html: ▼ considered: Heb. set thy heart on

verses.text_plain: Then Satan answered the Lord, and said, Doth Job fear God for nought?
verses.verse_html: 9Then Satan answered the Lord, and said, Doth Job fear God for nought?

verses.text_plain: Hast not thou made an hedge about him, and about his house, and about all that he hath on every side? thou hast blessed the work of his hands, and his substance is increased in the land.
verses.verse_html:
10Hast not thou made an hedge about him, and about his house, and about all that he hath on every side? thou hast blessed the work of his hands, and his substance is increased in the land. ▼
▼ substance: or, cattle

tokens.text: Hast not thou made an hedge
and about all that he hath on every side

verses.text_plain: But put forth thine hand now, and touch all that he hath, and he will curse thee to thy face.
verses.verse_html:
11But put forth thine hand now, and touch all that he hath, and he will curse thee to thy face. ▼
▼ and he…: Heb. if he curse thee not to thy face

tokens.text: all that he hath, and he will curse

footnotes.body_text: ▼ and he…: Heb. if he curse thee not to thy face
footnotes.body_html: ▼ and he…: Heb. if he curse thee not to thy face

verses.text_plain: And the Lord said unto Satan, Behold, all that he hath is in thy power; only upon himself put not forth thine hand. So Satan went forth from the presence of the Lord.
verses.verse_html:
12And the Lord said unto Satan, Behold, all that he hath is in thy power; only upon himself put not forth thine hand. So Satan went forth from the presence of the Lord. ▼
▼ power: Heb. hand

tokens.text: only upon himself put not forth

verses.text_plain: And there was a day when his sons and his daughters were eating and drinking wine in their eldest brother’s house:
verses.verse_html: 13And there was a day when his sons and his daughters were eating and drinking wine in their eldest brother’s house:

verses.text_plain: And there came a messenger unto Job, and said, The oxen were plowing, and the asses feeding beside them:
verses.verse_html: 14And there came a messenger unto Job, and said, The oxen were plowing, and the asses feeding beside them:

verses.text_plain: And the Sabeans fell upon them, and took them away; yea, they have slain the servants with the edge of the sword; and I only am escaped alone to tell thee.
verses.verse_html: 15And the Sabeans fell upon them, and took them away; yea, they have slain the servants with the edge of the sword; and I only am escaped alone to tell thee.

verses.text_plain: While he was yet speaking, there came also another, and said, The fire of God is fallen from heaven, and hath burned up the sheep, and the servants, and consumed them; and I only am escaped alone to tell thee.
verses.verse_html:
16While he was yet speaking, there came also another, and said, The fire of God is fallen from heaven, and hath burned up the sheep, and the servants, and consumed them; and I only am escaped alone to tell thee. ▼
▼ The fire…: or, A great fire

tokens.text: them; and I only am escaped

footnotes.body_text: ▼ The fire…: or, A great fire
footnotes.body_html: ▼ The fire…: or, A great fire

verses.text_plain: While he was yet speaking, there came also another, and said, The Chaldeans made out three bands, and fell upon the camels, and have carried them away, yea, and slain the servants with the edge of the sword; and I only am escaped alone to tell thee.
verses.verse_html:
17While he was yet speaking, there came also another, and said, The Chaldeans made out three bands, and fell upon the camels, and have carried them away, yea, and slain the servants with the edge of the sword; and I only am escaped alone to tell thee. ▼
▼ fell: Heb. rushed

verses.text_plain: While he was yet speaking, there came also another, and said, Thy sons and thy daughters were eating and drinking wine in their eldest brother’s house:
verses.verse_html: 18While he was yet speaking, there came also another, and said, Thy sons and thy daughters were eating and drinking wine in their eldest brother’s house:

verses.text_plain: And, behold, there came a great wind from the wilderness, and smote the four corners of the house, and it fell upon the young men, and they are dead; and I only am escaped alone to tell thee.
verses.verse_html:
19And, behold, there came a great wind from the wilderness, and smote the four corners of the house, and it fell upon the young men, and they are dead; and I only am escaped alone to tell thee. ▼
▼ from…: Heb. from aside, etc

footnotes.body_html: ▼ from…: Heb. from aside, etc

verses.text_plain: Then Job arose, and rent his mantle, and shaved his head, and fell down upon the ground, and worshipped,
verses.verse_html:
20Then Job arose, and rent his mantle, and shaved his head, and fell down upon the ground, and worshipped, ▼
▼ mantle: or, robe

verses.text_plain: And said, Naked came I out of my mother’s womb, and naked shall I return thither: the Lord gave, and the Lord hath taken away; blessed be the name of the Lord.
verses.verse_html: 21And said, Naked came I out of my mother’s womb, and naked shall I return thither: the Lord gave, and the Lord hath taken away; blessed be the name of the Lord.

verses.text_plain: In all this Job sinned not, nor charged God foolishly.
verses.verse_html:
22In all this Job sinned not, nor charged God foolishly. ▼
▼ charged…: or, attributed folly to God

footnotes.body_text: ▼ charged…: or, attributed folly to God
footnotes.body_html: ▼ charged…: or, attributed folly to God
